intro: Krynitzkia nemaclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved krynitzkia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it blooms during the summer months. Krynitzkia nemaclada is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade conditions.
